content: the modern crochet design textured square pattern royal touch is very easy to use to quickly create a blanket/afghan pillow bag and more in any size you desire the pattern will look best with a solid colour colors ombre or a long gradient yarn the pattern is very easy to memorize and gives you a lot freedom for your creativity you can make your item as large as you need as well you can make smaller squares and join them together the pattern is appropriate for intermediate level crocheters for beginners it would be challenging for more experienced ones this would be a fun and relaxing project the pattern includes a detailed description a stitch-chart and video tutorial in english us terminology and pictures to demonstrate final result stitches & abbreviations magic_ring circle st - stitch slip_stitch - slip_stitch space - space chain - chain single_crochet - single_crochet double_crochet - double_crochet bpdc - back post double_crochet bpslst - back post slip_stitch beginning ch2 and ch3 count as st information about the color change if you are using more than one color to create a visual effect as in the pictures above change the color when you start an even round 2 4 6 cut the previous color yarn and fasten_off changing two contrasting colors on each round is an option that creates different visual effect approximate size you can use the royal touch pattern to make an item in any size you prefer sizes of samples you will find below yarn and hook the samples of royal touch pattern were created using the following yarns and hooks one solid color - super baby iceyarns - fine weight/fingering/sport/baby hook size 4 mm 15 rounds = 10 5 in 26 5 cm square multi-color - angora print iceyarns - fine weight/fingering/sport/baby hook size 3 mm please note that i had to control the color change 15 rounds = 8 3 in 21 cm square gradient - cakes cotton fine iceyarns - fine weight/fingering/sport/baby hook size 3 mm 33 rounds = 14 8 in 37 5 cm square more pictures of the pattern samples you will find on ravelry you can use any yarn & hook you like that suits your project
